comments:
Specify a ManyToMany mapping in java and specify and JoinTable.  In orm.xml add the entity, but don't override the ManyToMany.  Every time you do validation you will get this NPE:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.mappings.IJoinTable$AbstractJoinColumnOwner.dbTable(IJoinTable.java:195)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.mappings.IJoinTable$JoinColumnOwner.dbTable(IJoinTable.java:278)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.content.orm.AbstractXmlNamedColumn.dbTable(AbstractXmlNamedColumn.java:456)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.content.orm.AbstractXmlNamedColumn.dbColumn(AbstractXmlNamedColumn.java:451)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.content.orm.AbstractXmlNamedColumn.isResolved(AbstractXmlNamedColumn.java:462)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.platform.JoinColumnContext.addToMessages(JoinColumnContext.java:116)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.platform.JoinTableContext.addToMessages(JoinTableContext.java:118)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.platform.XmlMultiRelationshipMappingContext.addJoinTableMessages(XmlMultiRelationshipMappingContext.java:77)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.platform.XmlMultiRelationshipMappingContext.addToMessages(XmlMultiRelationshipMappingContext.java:72)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.platform.XmlTypeContext.addToMessages(XmlTypeContext.java:357)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.platform.XmlEntityContext.addToMessages(XmlEntityContext.java:327)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.platform.MappingFileContext.addToMessages(MappingFileContext.java:165)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.platform.PersistenceUnitContext.addMappingFileMessages(PersistenceUnitContext.java:377)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.platform.PersistenceUnitContext.addToMessages(PersistenceUnitContext.java:365)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.platform.BaseJpaProjectContext.addToMessages(BaseJpaProjectContext.java:255)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.platform.BaseJpaPlatform.addToMessages(BaseJpaPlatform.java:207)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.JpaProject.validationMessages(JpaProject.java:638)
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.validation.JpaValidator.validateInJob(JpaValidator.java:39)
	at org.eclipse.wst.validation.internal.operations.ValidatorJob.run(ValidatorJob.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)
This occurs when the JoinTable specifiedName and defaultName are both null, such as when the target entity is not resolved.

Created an attachment (id=70142)
proposed patch

added a null check for when the JoinTable name is null (a valid case)
Reviewed and approved.  This is a simple null check that prevents validation from completing under the given scenario.  Very low-risk fix for a fairly bad problem.
